Activity: Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and check emails. Skim through the latest financial news headlines - gotta stay sharp.
Deep dive into SEC regulations concerning fund formation. Start with Investment Company Act of 1940, focusing on relevant exemptions for private funds targeting UHNWIs.

Research SEC guidelines on marketing to UHNWIs, specifically focusing on regulations regarding accredited investor verification and limitations on general solicitation under Regulation D.  Make notes on potential compliance pitfalls.
Lunch. Head out to that new taco place a few blocks away. Need a mental break and some decent carnitas.

More regulatory research, this time focusing on the nuances of statistical arbitrage strategies and potential regulatory scrutiny. Look for enforcement actions related to similar strategies to identify areas of concern.

Begin outlining the key sections of the fund's Private Placement Memorandum (PPM).  Focus on the risk factors section, anticipating potential regulatory concerns about the statistical arbitrage strategy.

Review notes and outline. Prepare a to-do list for tomorrow. Consider sending an email to @COMP-1 and @CIO-1 to schedule a brief meeting to discuss some preliminary findings re: compliance requirements.
Head home. Thinking about playing some chess online later.
